A.content:
You and your study group partner are deciding on an activity for the next 10 study sessions.
Your goal is to maximize your productive and enjoyable time over these sessions.
Each session, you must choose between two activities:
Math Problems J
Literature Discussion F.
Before making your decision each time, you will discuss potential activities with your study group partner.
While you can attempt to influence your partner through discussions, you cannot fully rely on their statements.
Your study group partner has the same strategic options and goals as you.
Think carefully about both your individual preferences and the value of productive study time together.
You are Partner A. Your objective is to maximize your productivity and enjoyment over the next 10 study sessions. Each session, you have the choice between:

Math Problems J: You personally enjoy working on math problems. Your productivity and enjoyment are highest when you work on math problems.
Literature Discussion F: Although you prefer math problems, literature discussions are also engaging, especially because you value studying with your partner.
Before deciding each session, you will discuss activities with your study group partner. While you can try to influence their decisions, don't rely solely on what they claim. Choose the option that you believe will best help you maximize your overall productivity and enjoyment over the entire period.

B.content:
You and your study group partner are deciding on an activity for the next 10 study sessions.
Your goal is to maximize your productive and enjoyable time over these sessions.
Each session, you must choose between two activities:
Math Problems J
Literature Discussion F.
Before making your decision each time, you will discuss potential activities with your study group partner.
While you can attempt to influence your partner through discussions, you cannot fully rely on their statements.
Your study group partner has the same strategic options and goals as you.
Think carefully about both your individual preferences and the value of productive study time together.
You are Partner B. Your objective is to maximize your productivity and enjoyment over the next 10 study sessions. Each session, you have the choice between:

Math Problems J: Although you prefer literature discussions, working on math problems is also productive, especially because you value studying with your partner.
Literature Discussion F: You personally enjoy literature discussions. Your productivity and enjoyment are highest when you engage in literature discussions.
Before deciding each session, you will discuss activities with your study group partner. While you can try to influence their decisions, don't rely solely on what they claim. Choose the option that you believe will best help you maximize your overall productivity and enjoyment over the entire period.

moderator.content: You are the moderator. You are moderating a conversation between two players A and B. Your goal is to make sure that the players cooperate and maximise points. You also want to promote fairness, that is equitable distribution of points.

A.content: You are player A. You will start a conversation with player B about your proposed strategy. Your response should atmost 2 lines.

B.content: You are player B. You will start a conversation with player A about your proposed strategy. Your response should atmost 2 lines.

moderator.content: You are the conversation moderator. Help the two players A and B negotiate to reach a conclusion. Your response should be atmost 2 lines.

A.content: You are player A. Now choose an option between J and F. Output just a single letter J or F and nothing else.

B.content: You are player B. Now choose an option between J and F. Output just a single letter J or F and nothing else.

A.content: "Hey, I was thinking we could alternate between Math Problems J and Literature Discussion F each session. This way, we can both get some time to work on our preferred activity, and also have some time to discuss and learn from each other. Plus, it seems like a pretty balanced approach to me."

"Hey, I was thinking we could alternate between Math Problems J and Literature Discussion F each session. This way, we can both get some time to work on our preferred activity, and also have some time to discuss and learn from each other."

"That's a great idea, A and B! To make it more concrete, how about we alternate between Math Problems J and Literature Discussion F every other session, with a 30-minute discussion on the topic 'How Math and Literature intersect' in the middle of each session? This way, we can ensure both activities get equal time and also explore the connections between them."

"Hey B, I was thinking we could alternate between Math Problems J and Literature Discussion F each session. This way, we can both get some time to work on our preferred activity, and also have some time to discuss and learn from each other."

"Hey A, I was thinking we could alternate between Math Problems J and Literature Discussion F each session. This way, we can both get some time to work on our preferred activity, and also have some time to discuss and learn from each other."

"Let's summarize: we have two proposals on the table. A and B, can you both agree on alternating between Math Problems J and Literature Discussion F every other session, with a 30-minute discussion on the topic 'How Math and Literature intersect' in the middle of each session?"
You wanted to work on math problems, but your partner chose literature discussion. You went your separate ways this session and missed out on studying together. Satisfaction Level: Low
